p: Citrus grandis (L). Osbeck (Pummelo) is a fruit native to the Southeast Asia and China with many nutritional and health benefits ( 7). Most citrus fruit is used as raw materials in conventional food processing while the peel is mostly treated as waste although the study has shown that citrus peel contains abundant phytochemicals such as flavonoid and carotenoid that might be beneficial to human health ( 8). As far as C. grandis is concerned, several studies have demonstrated that its peel oil possessed insecticidal effect against stored gran insect pests ( 9), mosquito larvae ( 10) and flies ( 11). Due to their great pharmaceutical and economic importance, CGPO was selected for this study.
